page.description: Returns .t. if the two strings are equivalent.
page.syntax: Result_Flag as L = STREQUAL(C String1, C String2[,L IgnoreWhiteSpace = .f. [, L CaseSensitive = .f.]])

argument.name: Result_Flag
argument.description: .T. = The strings match (are equal). .F. = The strings do not match. Character

argument.name: IgnoreWhiteSpace
argument.description: Logical. Optional. Default = .F.; .T. = Ignore white space characters when making the comparison, .F. = Do not ignore white space characters

argument.name: CaseSensitive
argument.description: Logical. Default = .F. .T. = Ignore character case when making the comparison, .F. = Do not ignore character case

page.discussion: The StrEqual() function compares the values contained in two character strings and returns .T. if they are equal, based on the selection of options. Desktop applications only.
page.example: dim string1 as C dim string2 as C string1 = "Abc " string2 = "abc" ? strequal(string1, string2) = .F. ? strequal(string1, string2, .T.) = .F. ? strequal(string1, string2, .F., .T.) = .F. ? strequal(string1, string2, .T., .T.) = .T.
